author: leslie s
title: Spring Break in Manhattan -
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I have stayed in quite a few Hampton Inns but this was the most pleasant visit. It all started with our friendly greeting by Carmel at the front desk. She smiled and was very helpful - not something one expects in New York City!
Our room was very comfortable and the bathroom was surprisingly large for NYCity standards. We had a closet, drawers, an extra fridge and a desk area. Even though our room faced 24th street it was surprisingly quiet. There were only 8 rooms per floor.
The entire staff was always pleasant and greeted us with a "good morning" every time. The breakfast was good - with yummy NY bagels! My only complaint was that there wasn't always room to sit down!
Transportation is nearby with many subway stations a block or 2 away.
